intro: Helmia cuspidata, commonly known as the scarlet pimpernel, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Violaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that are typically pink or red. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Helmia cuspidata is an herbaceous perennial that blooms from early summer to fall.
